Bug 1131862 - mcMerge: Display only the active milestones

The bzapi config target_milestone property on each product returns all
milestones for that product, including the inactive ones. A new property has
been added to the API, of form:

     "target_milestone_detail" : [
        {
           "id" : 2336,
           "is_active" : true,
           "name" : "---",
           "sortkey" : 0
        },

We now use target_milestone_detail instead of target_milestone, and filter on
is_active to find only the active milestones. We use map() to flattern the list
of activate milestone names, so existing consumers do not need to be adjusted.

Bug 1131862 - mcMerge: Combine the two loops that each iterate 'products'

Doesn't make sense to iterate through products twice. Moves the testsuiteFlagID
calculation up front, then generates 'milestones' and 'hasTestsuiteFlag' as part
of the same loop.

Bug 1131862 - mcMerge: Return early if 'products' missing from bzapi config

Check for the 'product' property up-front, rather than having conditionals on it
throughout. Also create a variable for products, to clean up the references.

Bug 1131862 - mcMerge: Rename products to hasTestsuiteFlag

For consistency with ConfigurationData.milestones
Bug 1131862 - mcMerge: Rename testsuiteFlag to testsuiteFlagID
Bug 975400 - Always set the status-firefoxXY flag when changes get uplifted (or integrated with the flag set to affected). r=graememcc
Bug 1079937 - Remove b2g28_v1_3t from TBPL.
Bug 1096422 - Update bz.js to v0.3.0
Bug 1096422 - Remove unused third party libraries
Bug 1096407 - Remove repos that are disabled in buildbot; r=RyanVM

Bug 1072923 - mcMerge: Move hgweb version.txt retrieval client-side

Previously, version.txt was retrieved from hg.mozilla.org via
getFlags.php, since the access control header did not permit us to do
so in the client. That has now been fixed (bug 774766), so we can now
remove the only server-side component of mcMerge, thereby simplifying
hosting requirements.

Bug 1072923 - mcMerge: Move handling of flag product names to FlagLoader.js

To help with the deprecation of getFlags.php, the determination of the
flag product name (eg "firefox" or "thunderbird") is now moved from
getFlags.php to FlagLoader.js, leaving getFlags.php as simply a means
to obtain the version number.

Bug 1072923 - mcMerge: Move handling of B2G repo flags to FlagLoader.js

Prior to this patch, getFlags.php was out of date with respect to the
list of valid B2G release repos. In the future we should fix the
handling of these repos (they use a different versioning scheme and do
not use tracking flags, only status), however to simplify the transition
away from getFlags.php, this patch maintains the unsupported B2G repo
behaviour - that is mcMerge.trackingFlag and mcMerge.statusFlag have
the same value before and after this patch: null.

Bug 1072923 - mcMerge: Move handling of ESR repo flags to FlagLoader.js

The version for ESR repositories is a constant, since they're release branches.
This means we can skip fetching the version number from the repo, a perf win.
However it makes more sense to handle this client side, and doing so
also helps with the deprecation of getFlags.php.

Bug 912788 - mcMerge: Only use the first line of commit messages; r=graememcc

Only use the first line of the commit message, to avoid false positives when
checking for bug numbers and backouts later. This prevents B2G bumper bot
commits from being detected as a bug in need of marking due to the bug numbers
in the extended commit message. The commit message hook enforces that the bug
number is in the first line, so this won't miss valid cases.

Bug 1693292 - remove code to set default milestone as option following '---' milestone. r=RyanVM

The milestones for bugzilla products have stopped being ordered in
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/latest/configuration?flags=1

Bugherder has code to pick the milestone after the '---' one if no common
milestone has been detected (e.g. 'mozillaXX' and 'XX branch' with XX being
the version number). A check revealed this code only gets taken by the
'Mozilla Localizations' product nowadays which also has outdated milestone.
Let's drop the code.

Bug 1678132 - switch calls fetching bugzilla configuration to REST API. r=RyanVM

REST endpoint got added in bug 1622867 and /latest/configuration will be
deprecated.

Bug 1658093 - Add underscore to Thunderbird tracking flag names.

The tracking and status flags for Thunderbird have an underscore in their
names since Thunderbird 30. The resulting flags are cf_tracking_thunderbird_XX
and cf_status_thunderbird_XX. This is different than the assumption that there
is no underscore as is the case for the Firefox flags.
This sticks the additional underscore in the "productName" variable in FlagLoader
as that variable only gets used to generate the flag names.

Add missing phantomjs dependency

In npm v3+ (which ships with node v5+) peer dependencies are not
automatically installed, so phantomjs needs to be explicitly listed in
package.json rather than relying on it being installed as a side effect
of installing karma-phantomjs-launcher.

Bug 1204521 - Add a Node.js static webserver & Heroku configuration

This adds a Node.js static web server using the Express framework:
http://expressjs.com/
http://expressjs.com/starter/static-files.html

Which is then run on Heroku using the Node.js buildpack:
https://github.com/heroku/heroku-buildpack-nodejs

In production, the cache-control header has a max-age of 15 minutes, and
in development it is set to zero.

In addition, we use the express-sslify Express middleware to redirect
HTTP to HTTPS in production:
https://github.com/florianheinemann/express-sslify

Running the server locally is done using:
`npm install --production && npm start`

Bug 1204521 - Move public assets under bugherder/

So it's simpler to specify what should and shouldn't be served.
